Judul: IDENTIFYING INDONESIAN CONSUMER BUYING BEHAVIOR TO DESIGN GUNDAM MODEL KITS MARKETING STRATEGY
Abstrak:
Nowadays, people in Indonesia can have hobbies and collect things that are produced overseas. With the introduction of television, satellite, and especially internet, it is easy to find information about things they want to collect. And one of the most popular that is collected by Indonesian people is Gundam plastic model kit that produced in Japan. Mobile Suit Gundam is a metaseries created by Sunrise that first aired in 1979 and until now the series already released in numerous media like TV series, OVA's, manga, photo novels, and video games. Gundam plastic model kit is plastic model that depicting the mechanical robots, vehicles, and characters from the Mobile Suit Gundam series. The 

model kits consist of some line-up, they are Super Deformed, High Grade, Master Grade, Perfect Grade, Real Grade, and Mega Size Model. 

The objective of this research is to measure Indonesian Gundam Otaku buying behavior by using consumer decision journey with AISAS and 4P model, motivation analysis, and Gundam Plastic Model market condition, so marketers could identify and develop marketing strategy to maximize the opportunity that existing in people who collect Gundam Plastic Model and new consumers. This study concludes two stages, the qualitative study and the quantitative study. The qualitative study used for determining the condition and the problem identification. The quantitative study includes the 

questionnaire and the analysis. The target population in this study is Indonesian people who collect Gundam Model Kit. Respondents are Indonesian people that collecting Gundam Model kit from different backgrounds. The number of sample for this research is 250. Descriptive analysis, frequency analysis, and cross tabulation were used to analyze the data. 

The findings including how Indonesian Gundam Model Kit collectors know the product for the first time, the favorited line-up, how much they spend for their collection, how they usually buy their collection, which friend that affect them in collecting the model kit, and the decision factors that affect them in collecting Gundam Model Kit. Not all Indonesian Gundam otaku can recall how they firstly know about Gundam, mostly from the film and the visual. Only few that started collecting because of their friend. From all line-up, the most favorited line-up by Indonesian Gundam otaku is 

the Master Grade line-up, because of the size and and good feature of products in this line-up. Most of Indonesian Gundam otaku spend about Rp 500.000-1.000.000 in last three months, which is equal to buy one or two Master Grade kit. Most of Indonesian Gundam otaku buy their collections online, showing that they already believe in online purchasing and they are net citizen. Friends from the community are the most affecting group in collecting Gundam Model kit. The Indonesian Gundam 

otaku important buying decision factors are price, information, and series that they are following. Based on the cross tabulation analysis, the price consideration is affected by the information about the 

product, which is about the product worth, and the series that they are following, which is about preferences. Other than that, from the cross tabulation analysis also found that the line-up that people collecting is affecting the amount of spending. Based on the findings, marketing strategy that can be implemented based on the AISAS model are do movie screening in crowded place, put visual to make people aware, display the products to increase people's interest, information spreading on internet, and online sharing. The future research recommendation are focusing the research on other Japanese toys like Bandai's SIC, Kaiyodo's Revoltech, etc, doing the research in other countries, use different methods to formulate the marketing strategy, a research on favorited Gundam series by Indonesian Gundam otaku, or study about fandom in Indonesia.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Pembimbing : Ir. CO Budi Permadi Iskandar, M.SP
Kata Kunci: Consumer Behaviors, Consumer Preferences, Buying Decision Factors, AISAS, 4P Marketing Mix
